page.title: 02FARMLAND
page.content: The land is hilly with deep valleys and a small amount of good pastureland joining the River Teme.The land is plouged,sown and fertilised and grassland used for pasture,hay and silage. A very small amount of Barley(16acres),Rape(40acres)and Swedes(30acres) are grown for cattle and sheep feed.Six thousand Clun,Mule and Bealah crossed breeding Ewes fat lambs which sold between July and December averaging Â£2 per kilo live weight.Three hundred and fifty Welsh Black and Hereford Cross cows are crossed with Charalais Bulls to produce three hundred and fifty fat cattle which sold all through the year for approximately Â£1 per kilo live weight.The price of land is between Â£500-Â£1000 per acre.Multipurpose Farm Buildings are situated at the Main Farms in the area.
